intro: Psychotria goetzei, commonly known as the "blue cohosh" or "wild ginger," is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria goetzei is also known for its potential medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
